title: Gideon66
author: Gideon66
content: In recent years niger has been know for cryptocurrency fraud. Most scammers in Nigeria used social media like Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp to decieve people into investing crypto with the promise of getting higher returns with little risk, while they will steal your money. This have lead to the scrutiny of crypto government have warn against investment in cryptocurrency. Many Nigerians today see cryptocurrencies have a way for them to over come the high inflation. This is a very important notice before investing crypto in Nigeria.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Nigeria has been the hub for cryptocurrency in Africa and that has made many young Nigerians find a means of livelihood through it by leveraging on the many opportunities that this cryptocurrency investment provides. Scammers and fraudsters are now finding shade in this technology to hide from their illegal activities, this negativity shouldn’t be allowed to brainwash you into not learning about bitcoin technology. As a very good investment, their will always be people that always looks for the disadvantages and not putting the advantages into consideration despite it showing signs of positivity and productiveness to the society.

comments.body: When they talk about internet fraud most Nigerians do think that Nigeria is the worst country with internet fraud and this mentality is  drawn from the limited scope they have that's just revolving around their immediate milieu but when you're exposed to the knowledge about the outside world you get to read and know about events happening in the outside world away from your own country and with a comparative analysis you arrive at the understanding that your country is the least among country with fraudulent internet cases. comments.author: Justbillywitt
comments.body: Why I frown against any form of fraudulent activities by the Nigerian youths and their modes of operations. This has totally given the country a bad reputation in the international community. Although this not only peculiar to the Nigerian community. There is no country in the world that does not do fraud. But I don't think Nigerian government is fighting crypto because of the fraud associated with it by few individuals. Generally Nigerian government doesn't like an avenue where the youth of the country are meeting their financial needs. To me their are against crypto because they think it will affect their other forms of investment and the youth wont be depending on them any more. You know say our politicians dem dey like make youth dey continue to be their errands boys and whistle blowers on who is not supporting them. Normally them know say the more them keep the youth in poverty the easier e go be for them to win election. Na poverty dey make boys they go carry ballot boxes during election. Secondly the youths were not saving their money in the banks any more and the government saw this as a treat to them. You know say na youth plenty pass for this country. So I don't think it's fraud that is making the Nigerian government fight crypto in Nigeria. There is fraud in every aspect in the country.
